intro: Dactylostemon klotzschii var. heterophyllus, commonly known as the variable leaf dactylostemon, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, often hairy leaves that vary in shape and size. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or heathland environments. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
